required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tracking Attempts of CSE, Epidural and Spinal Insertions (TRACES)
clinical_study.official_title: Tracking Attempts of CSE, Epidural and Spinal Insertions (TRACES)

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to compare observed neuraxial (Epidural, spinal, combined spinal-epidural) insertion attempts with actual documented attempts in anesthesia providers (staff, residents and fellows) at one maternal hospital. Trained research staff will document the number of neuraxial attempts before the operation, and compare this with the attempts recorded in the patient's chart. The definition of a neuraxial attempt will be determined before the study begins through a thorough literature review.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent accuracy of recorded neuraxial attempts
primary_outcome.description: Charted neuraxial attempts divided by observed neuraxial attempts

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent accuracy of recorded neuraxial redirections
secondary_outcome.description: Charted neuraxial attempts divided by number of observed attempts and redirections
Use thorough literature review to establish a working definition of a neuraxial attempt
Use thorough literature review to establish a working definition of a neuraxial redirection

secondary_outcome.measure: Departmental consensus on a neuraxial attempt
secondary_outcome.description: Survey the department to understand how staff define a neuraxial attempt
Percentage completion of requisite charting prompts on anesthesia record

study_pop.textblock: Patients must meet the inclusion criteria, and give verbal consent to being watched. Providers must give verbal consent to being watched

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy parturients receiving any neuraxial procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusal of observation
- Provider refusal of observation

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD will not be shared with other researchers
